description: See below for details on what is included in this contract
full_summary:
# Upgrade Exterior Drainage System, Onion Lake, SK

## Tender Notice Title:

Upgrade Exterior Drainage System, Onion Lake, SK

## Solicitation Number:

M5000-22-5046/B

## Publication Date:

2023-06-01

## Tender Closing Date:

2023-06-15T15:00:00

### Introduction

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) invites interested parties to tender for the upgrade of the exterior drainage system at the Onion Lake, SK location.

### Objective

The objective of this project is to upgrade the exterior drainage system to ensure proper water flow and prevent water accumulation around the building foundations. The scope of work includes, but is not limited to:

- Site preparation and demolition of existing structures
- Installation of new drainage tiles and weeping systems
- Application of waterproofing membrane to the exterior walls
- Backfilling and landscaping

### Contract Requirements

The successful bidder must:

- Provide a detailed work schedule for review and approval by the site authority and senior asset manager
- Follow all safety protocols and regulations
- Meet the current federal and provincial regulations for disposal and recycling of materials
- Ensure proper grading and drainage of the site
- Complete the work by November 30, 2023

### Pre-Qualification and Tendering Process

This is a two-phase tendering process:

- Phase 1: Pre-qualification of bidders based on mandatory requirements
- Phase 2: Financial bid submission based on specifications and drawings

### Notice of Proposed Procurement (NPP)

This notice is posted on the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) and is available for download at [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities). Canada is not responsible for information found on third-party websites.

### Indigenous Procurement

The RCMP encourages Indigenous businesses to participate in this tendering process. The federal Indigenous Business Directory (IBD) is an online resource for identifying Indigenous business capacity.

### Contact Information

For more information, please contact:

Teresa Hengen
Contracting Officer
RCMP
(639) 625-3449
teresa.hengen@rcmp-grc.gc.ca

### Procurement Category

This procurement falls under the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and the Procurement Strategy for Indigenous Businesses.

### Language of the Contract

English and French are the official languages of the contract.
